intro: Hieracium karagoellense, commonly known as the Karagoellen hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Hieracium karagoellense is known for its adaptability to arid conditions and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
